metadata.dc:author: Boto, G R
metadata.dc:description: Trigeminal neuralgia continues to be an illness poorly known for many general practitioners and what is even worse, badly handled by many of the specialists in charge of cephalic neuralgias. In this paper I resume the main knowledge about trigeminal neuralgia reviewing the clinical, physiopathological, and therapeutical aspects of this condition.
